medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric pain radiating to the left upper quadrant, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with 5 days of epigastric pain that radiates to the left upper quadrant and not to the back, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. Symptoms worsened to the extent that the patient could not tolerate oral intake for several hours. Initially reported sharp left-sided chest pain that resolved after treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Hyperlipidemia 2. Transient ischemic attack (TIA) ___ years ago 3. Hypertension 4. Gout 5. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)/Asthma 6. Chronic kidney disease 7. Tracheomalacia 8. Osteoarthritis of knees s/p Left total knee replacement, Right total knee replacement pending 9. Lung nodule resected 10. Coronary artery disease (CAD) with 2-vessel disease s/p PTCA/stent.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and father both had cancer but died at elderly ages.
